column3:
> Also, this undoes #4322, as it would introduce an infinite loop otherwise. I suspect that these convenience targets get very little use anymore, but we can always add back hard-coded ones if necessary.

Which ones does this prevent use of? I use `make src/bitcoind` a lot.
@laanwj Only obscure targets. The bins are still listed there explicitly: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/Makefile.am#L165, so ```make src/bitcoind``` still works.
> @laanwj Only obscure targets. The bins are still listed there explicitly: \n\nSounds good to me then.

> This change makes sure that autoheader is re-run (as it's supposed to be) any time configure.ac is touched.\n\nSomething that makes me wonder: shouldn't the *entire* process re-run when configure.ac is touched? Or is that the effect of this - was autoheader the only step missing for that?

Yes, that should be the case now. For some reason automake doesn't push the autoheader rules down to subdirs, so it was never re-triggered if you build from src/.\n\nThinking about it now, we should probably backport this for 0.14.2 as well, since switching branches is one of the most common ways this problem can show up.

> Thinking about it now, we should probably backport this for 0.14.2 as well, since switching branches is one of the most common ways this problem can show up.\n\nGood point - I don't switch branches anymore for this reason (among others). I just have a git-worktree checkout per branch.
Any idea why we need to explicitly do this? Normally autotools takes care of it automagically...
@luke-jr I'm not sure. I suppose it's just an autotools bug that they don't generate the rules for subdirs.
